channel.title: Two-sentence Dungeon World one-shot
channel.description:
Today I saw a rumour tweeted by [@randomdnd](http://twitter.com/randomdnd), and immediately thought it would make a fantastic stepping off for a single session of **Dungeon World**:
> You lose her near a desolate prison flooded with giant chuul. The hag said that the Dream Shard of Death was fought here. #dnd
*What are you doing?*
From here, you can extrapolate the ambiguities in the hook to generate some compost for the game. If you have a D6 closer to hand than a playgroup, use these instead:
#### Who is *she*?
- 1-3: a master ironmonger - 4-5: the hag - 6: a pregnant duchess
#### Lose her?
- 1-3: Lost her trail - 4-5: Escaped her chase - 6: She died
#### What caused the desolation?
- 1-3: Dragonfire - 4-5: Plague - 6: Geostationary comet
#### Who was imprisoned?
- 1-3: War criminals - 4-5: Heretic scholars - 6: A nascent godling
#### The hag?
- 1-3: Grendeldam, mother of trolls - 4-5: An accursed warlock - 6: Terrestrial boneless lamprey
#### The Dream Shard of Death?
- 1-3: A sentient glaive - 4-5: An historic troupe of would-be heroes - 6: A gestalt anthropocorpus
#### Fought...
- 1-3: And slain - 4-5: And fled - 6: But never bested
### Do you have some grim portents?
No.
Just use a couple of small *clocks* and extrapolate from whichever thread isn't being directly addressed right now.
